TEXT.English: In a strange land where religious immigrants look back fondly to medieval times, the graveyard often is a place of fear and superstition. On the other hand it's a place to visit lost loved ones for quiet contemplation. Emotional conflicts arise.
The two certainties in life are death and taxes. The graveyard handles one. The King takes care of the other.

At first settlers import candy from the home country but before long an enterprising confectioner realizes that sugar is growing right next door, and all that's needed is a way to flavour it - maybe chocolate or vanilla. There's one other trick; grinding the sugar so fine that the candy has a smooth consistency.

Having a candy store means that the settlers and their children don't need to wait for the ship to come in from Europe to satisfy their sweet tooth. The local confectioner makes everybody happy, the dentist in particular.
The confectioner's shop adds extra variety, candy for every taste, along with traditional sweets that remind people of home. The bigger market helps to keep prices down.

Extra production creates trading opportunities. Some confectioners even set up tables where tea is served to accompany the treats. A very few offer coffee, at first considered scandalous, because the drink is so stimulating.

The candy factory can serve an entire region. For one group it offers cheap sweets thanks to economies of scale. For the well-to-do it delivers an unparalleled variety of exotic confections to impress guests on special occasions.
A big confectionery makes an important contribution to the region it serves, increasing both trading income and the community's happiness.
Leather is good at keeping out the wind but when the temperature drops it still feels cold. Putting padding into leather coats keeps people warm when the snow flies.
Sewing padding into leather doesn't just make the clothes more comfortable. By adding insulation the leather clothier improves health for those working outside, which can even save their lives.
TEXT.French: Coudre un rembourrage et une doublure dans le cuir ne rend pas seulement le vêtement plus confortable. En ajoutant de l'isolation, il améliore également la santé des personnes travaillant à l'extérieur, et peut même leur sauver la vie.
TEXT.German: Das Einnähen von Polstern und Futter in Leder macht das Kleidungsstück nicht nur bequemer. Durch die zusätzliche Isolierung wird auch die Gesundheit derjenigen verbessert, die im Freien arbeiten, und kann sogar ihr Leben retten.
TEXT.Italian: Cucire un'imbottitura e una fodera nella pelle non rende solo l'indumento più confortevole. L'aggiunta di isolamento migliora anche la salute di chi lavora all'aperto e può addirittura salvargli la vita.
TEXT.Spanish: Coser acolchado y forro a la piel no sólo hace que la prenda sea más cómoda. Al añadir aislamiento, también mejora la salud de quienes trabajan al aire libre, e incluso puede salvarles la vida.

TEXT.English: A bigger business can produce a little more for export, not just to Europe but also to the surrounding First Nations and outdoor workers who appreciate warm clothing. A fashionable leather clothier relies on word of mouth to increase business.

Practical people see the advantage of insulated clothing in a cold climate. Devout settlers are obsessed with religious prohibitions, so women of easy virtue can earn extra money wearing leather in private to dominate the pious.

A big business has efficiencies and economies of scale. A solitary leather clothier might spend days fitting a coat to a single customer but a factory can have enough sizes in stock for everyone to buy off the rack.
Sturdy outdoor leather clothing that stands up to hard wear means more work gets done, people don't get cold, and health and happiness are the result.

Pressing oil is an ancient craft in Europe, particularly in Mediterranean cultures. Equipment that crushes olives for their oil can be adapted to work with rapeseed.[NEWLINE]Before European contact cooking oil was essential for Pacific Northwest Native nations. Oolichan oil from candlefish made up so much of Native commerce that the trade routes were called "grease trails".
TEXT.French: Le pressage de l'huile est un artisanat ancien en Europe, notamment dans les cultures méditerranéennes. Les équipements qui écrasent les olives pour en extraire l'huile peuvent être adaptés au colza. Avant le contact avec les Européens, l'huile de cuisson était essentielle pour les nations autochtones du nord-ouest du Pacifique. L'huile d'oolichan provenant de la chandelle constituait une si grande partie du commerce amérindien que les routes commerciales étaient appelées "pistes de graisse".
TEXT.German: Das Pressen von Öl ist ein altes Handwerk in Europa, insbesondere in den Mittelmeerkulturen. Die Geräte, mit denen Oliven zur Gewinnung von Öl gepresst werden, können auch für die Verarbeitung von Raps verwendet werden.[NEWLINE]Vor dem Kontakt mit den Europäern war Speiseöl für die Ureinwohner des pazifischen Nordwestens lebenswichtig. Oolichan-Öl aus Kerzenfisch machte einen so großen Teil des Handels der Ureinwohner aus, daß die Handelsrouten als "Fettstraßen" bezeichnet wurden.
TEXT.Italian: La spremitura dell'olio è un'attività antica in Europa, in particolare nelle culture mediterranee. Le attrezzature che schiacciano le olive per ricavarne l'olio possono essere adattate alla colza.[NEWLINE]Prima del contatto europeo, l'olio da cucina era essenziale per i nativi del Pacifico nordoccidentale. L'olio di oolichan ricavato dal pesce candela costituiva una parte così importante del commercio dei nativi che le rotte commerciali venivano chiamate "vie del grasso".
TEXT.Spanish: El prensado del aceite es un antiguo oficio en Europa, sobre todo en las culturas mediterráneas. Antes del contacto europeo, el aceite de cocina era esencial para las naciones indígenas del noroeste del Pacífico. El aceite de oolichan procedente del pez vela constituía una parte tan importante del comercio nativo que las rutas comerciales se llamaban "rutas de la grasa".

TEXT.English: Settlers eating wild game soon realize that it has much less fat than they're used to from domestic animals. In a cold climate fat keeps workers warm outdoors. In the wilderness plant oils are a good path to a balanced diet.
As the oil pressers refine their trade the quality of the oil attracts new customers.
Oil pressers can now separate their pressings into varying grades to be sold at different prices. As customers discuss which is better for different situations, sales increase.
If there's a good supply of olives and rapeseed, the oil presses can be mechanized to generate exportable quantities.
If surplus quantities of oil and rapeseed can be grown close to the factory, an ambitious manager might prove himself by exporting the very best olive oil to Italy.
Peanuts are widely grown in the tropics and subtropics. Botanically they're a member of the bean family but in cooking they're used like a nut. Unlike most legumes peanut pods mature underground.
TEXT.French: Les cacahuètes sont largement cultivées dans les régions tropicales et subtropicales. Sur le plan botanique, elles font partie de la famille des haricots, mais en cuisine, elles sont utilisées comme des noix. Contrairement à la plupart des légumineuses, les gousses d'arachide mûrissent sous terre.
TEXT.German: Erdnüsse werden in den Tropen und Subtropen weit verbreitet angebaut. Botanisch gesehen gehören sie zur Familie der Bohnengewächse, aber in der Küche werden sie wie eine Nuss verwendet. Im Gegensatz zu den meisten Hülsenfrüchten reifen Erdnussschoten unterirdisch.
TEXT.Italian: Le arachidi sono ampiamente coltivate nei tropici e nelle regioni subtropicali. Dal punto di vista botanico fanno parte della famiglia dei fagioli, ma in cucina vengono utilizzate come una noce. A differenza della maggior parte dei legumi, i baccelli delle arachidi maturano sottoterra.
TEXT.Spanish: Los cacahuetes se cultivan ampliamente en las zonas tropicales y subtropicales. Botánicamente pertenecen a la familia de las judías, pero en la cocina se utilizan como frutos secos. A diferencia de la mayoría de las legumbres, las vainas de los cacahuetes maduran bajo tierra.

TEXT.English: Peanuts are an excellent source of protein and vitamins. They complement traditional European grains, contributing to workers' health and stamina.

Though they can be boiled, fresh harvested raw peanuts are usually roasted before being eaten. Enterprising roasters soon learn to add salt or grind the peanuts into peanut butter. Other nut butters soon follow.
Once dried, peanuts last for a long time in a scout's saddlebags or in the barrels on a wagon. Peanut oil is also valuable for cooking.

As peanut growers start to deliver large crops, roasters extend the market beyond their own cities, promoting the peanut as an exotic delicacy in temperate regions where it won't grow, Europe for example.

A region with a big peanut roasting factory helps keep workers healthy. Peanuts are especially important where slave populations need added protein. Their owners can afford to eat meat, increasing their risk of heart disease.
Pottery is an ancient way to store grain. In the rainy insect-ridden New World pots hold enough grain to keep settlers alive through the winter until they can finally plant their new crops in spring.
TEXT.French: La poterie est un moyen ancien de stocker le grain. Dans le Nouveau Monde pluvieux et infesté d'insectes, les pots contiennent suffisamment de céréales pour permettre aux colons de survivre pendant l'hiver jusqu'à ce qu'ils puissent enfin planter leurs nouvelles cultures au printemps.
TEXT.German: Töpferwaren sind eine uralte Methode zur Lagerung von Getreide. In der regnerischen, von Insekten heimgesuchten Neuen Welt enthielten die Töpfe genug Getreide, um die Siedler über den Winter am Leben zu erhalten, bis sie im Frühjahr endlich ihre neue Ernte einpflanzen konnten.
TEXT.Italian: La ceramica è un modo antico di conservare il grano. Nel Nuovo Mondo, caratterizzato da piogge e insetti, i vasi contengono abbastanza grano per mantenere i coloni in vita durante l'inverno, fino a quando non possono piantare le nuove colture in primavera.
TEXT.Spanish: La cerámica es una forma antigua de almacenar grano. En el lluvioso Nuevo Mundo, plagado de insectos, las vasijas contienen grano suficiente para mantener vivos a los colonos durante el invierno, hasta que por fin pueden plantar sus nuevas cosechas en primavera.

TEXT.English: Pottery lets villages store their surplus grain to get them through the hungry winter. Loading sturdy pots into wagons is a handy way to ship grain and supply food to new settlements.

As the pottery business grows employees specialize. Most of the money comes in for sturdy practical pots holding everything from rice to rum, but a few creative types form imaginative vessels with decorative patterns, some merely for display. The Puritans strongly object.
With food and drink stored securely in pottery, life is now less precarious. Businesses feel safer taking risks and so the communities grow.
Pottery factories can be built near the best sources of clay, thus delivering high quality at a cheap price.
With every type of pot in demand, the pottery factory owners are squirrelling away pots of money.

At first women prided themselves on sewing all their families' clothes, getting their cloth from the weaver. The tailor needs to show his garments are better, or hope that people assume they're better simply because he's a man.
The tailor creates the well-dressed man, stylish and ready to succeed at diplomacy, business or romance.
The tailor's shop grows to include a variety of sub-trades. The cutter seldom sews the garment. A different specialist chooses the perfect fabric for every style.

Having a tailor's shop is a sign of success for a growing town. If the shop has a tailor who's fashionable, everyone from the elder statesman to the firebrand preacher will buy there so they can look their best.

A tailors' factory offers less prestige than an exclusive shop but it makes up for that in output. Young workers with an eye on advancement can buy off the rack at a fraction of the cost of a personal fitting.
The tailors' factory demonstrates that menswear is widely available. It's proof that a city has arrived socially.

Well away from other buildings the powder maker mixes gunpowder from sulphur, charcoal and saltpeter: ammunition for the soldiers' guns. In colonial times it's the only available explosive (dynamite will be invented in 1867) so it's also used for artillery, mining and road building.
TEXT.French: A l'écart des autres bâtiments, le poudrier mélange la poudre à canon à partir de soufre, de charbon de bois et de salpêtre : des munitions pour les fusils des soldats. À l'époque coloniale, c'est le seul explosif disponible (la dynamite sera inventée en 1867). Elle est donc également utilisée pour l'artillerie, l'exploitation minière et la construction de routes.
TEXT.German: Weit entfernt von anderen Gebäuden mischt der Pulvermacher Schießpulver aus Schwefel, Holzkohle und Salpeter für die Gewehre der Soldaten. In der Kolonialzeit ist es der einzige verfügbare Sprengstoff (Dynamit wird erst 1867 erfunden) und wird auch für die Artillerie, den Bergbau und den Straßenbau verwendet.
TEXT.Italian: Ben lontano da altri edifici, il polveriere mescola la polvere da sparo con zolfo, carbone e salnitro: munizioni per i cannoni dei soldati. In epoca coloniale è l'unico esplosivo disponibile (la dinamite sarà inventata nel 1867), quindi viene utilizzato anche per l'artiglieria, le miniere e la costruzione di strade.
TEXT.Spanish: Alejado de otros edificios, el polvorero mezcla pólvora a partir de azufre, carbón vegetal y salitre: munición para las armas de los soldados. En la época colonial es el único explosivo disponible (la dinamita se inventará en 1867), por lo que también se utiliza para la artillería, la minería y la construcción de carreteras.

TEXT.English: The powder maker needs to produce enough black powder so that soldiers are well-supplied to defend their settlements. Even more is needed for miners and the pioneers building roads.
As the business gets bigger, the black powder is stored in kegs which represent a massive increase in explosive power, so much that “powder keg” becomes a metaphor for high risk.
Black powder may be dangerous, but it's not as dangerous as having a weak army without enough ammunition.

The powder maker supplies propellant for guns and artillery, and explosives for mining and road building. For a big army so much has to be kept in kegs that an unlucky event in this building can blow up the entire town.

Centralizing production of propellant for guns and artillery, and explosives for mining and road building, is efficient but it means powder trains of vulnerable wagons are now on the roads, open to attack.

At first every household bakes its own bread but soon the baker's house centralizes food production. The baker starts work well before dawn so that households can have their daily bread. Settlers who remember the early starvation days continue to grow squash, beans and corn but new arrivals prefer familiar food from the old country.
TEXT.French: Au début, chaque foyer cuit son propre pain, mais bientôt la maison du boulanger centralise la production alimentaire. Le boulanger commence à travailler bien avant l'aube pour que les ménages puissent avoir leur pain quotidien. Les colons qui se souviennent des premiers jours de famine continuent de cultiver des courges, des haricots et du maïs, mais les nouveaux arrivants préfèrent les aliments familiers du vieux pays.
TEXT.German: Zunächst bäckt jeder Haushalt sein eigenes Brot, doch schon bald wird die Lebensmittelproduktion durch die Bäckereien zentralisiert. Der Bäcker beginnt seine Arbeit lange vor dem Morgengrauen, damit die Haushalte ihr tägliches Brot bekommen. Siedler, die sich an die frühen Hungertage erinnern, bauen weiterhin Kürbisse, Bohnen und Mais an, aber Neuankömmlinge bevorzugen die vertrauten Lebensmittel aus dem alten Land.
TEXT.Italian: All'inizio ogni famiglia prepara il proprio pane, ma presto la casa del fornaio centralizza la produzione di cibo. Il fornaio inizia a lavorare molto prima dell'alba, in modo che le famiglie possano avere il pane quotidiano. I coloni che ricordano i primi tempi di fame continuano a coltivare zucche, fagioli e mais, ma i nuovi arrivati preferiscono il cibo familiare del vecchio Paese.
TEXT.Spanish: Al principio, cada hogar hornea su propio pan, pero pronto la casa del panadero centraliza la producción de alimentos. El panadero empieza a trabajar mucho antes del amanecer para que los hogares puedan tener su pan diario. Los colonos que recuerdan los primeros días de hambruna siguen cultivando calabaza, judías y maíz, pero los recién llegados prefieren la comida familiar del viejo país.

TEXT.English: Having a bakery means each household doesn't need to bake its own bread. That allows other colonists to spend time on what they do best. Specialization helps the economy to grow, a concept soon popularized in books by economists Adam Smith and David Ricardo.
TEXT.French: Le fait d'avoir une boulangerie signifie que chaque foyer n'a pas besoin de cuire son propre pain. Cela permet aux autres colons de consacrer du temps à ce qu'ils font le mieux. La spécialisation favorise la croissance de l'économie, un concept bientôt popularisé dans les livres des économistes Adam Smith et David Ricardo.
TEXT.German: Mit einer Bäckerei muss nicht jeder Haushalt sein eigenes Brot backen. So können die anderen Kolonisten ihre Zeit mit dem verbringen, was sie am besten können. Spezialisierung hilft der Wirtschaft zu wachsen, ein Konzept, das schon bald in den Büchern der Ökonomen Adam Smith und David Ricardo popularisiert wurde.
TEXT.Italian: Avere un panificio significa che ogni famiglia non ha bisogno di cuocere il proprio pane. Questo permette agli altri coloni di dedicare il loro tempo a ciò che sanno fare meglio. La specializzazione aiuta l'economia a crescere, un concetto presto reso popolare nei libri degli economisti Adam Smith e David Ricardo.
TEXT.Spanish: Tener una panadería significa que cada hogar no necesita hornear su propio pan. Eso permite a los demás colonos dedicar su tiempo a lo que mejor saben hacer. La especialización contribuye al crecimiento de la economía, un concepto que pronto se popularizó en los libros de los economistas Adam Smith y David Ricardo.

TEXT.English: As the bakery gets more workers it might add a pastry chef who creates sweet treats that bring in business. The business also provides a variety of loaves so that new arrivals can buy the kind of bread that reminds them of home.

As the bakery grows, offering cookies and pastries, it becomes a social center. Some bakers even set up tables where tea is served to accompany the treats. A few serve coffee which is considered scandalous because of the stimulating effect.
A large bakery serves a region. On the one hand it offers cheap food thanks to economies of sale. On the other it delivers an unparalleled variety of pastries, pies and cakes for special occasions.
A big bakery makes an important contribution to the region it serves, increasing both the food supply and the community's happiness.

Village courthouses handle small property disputes and local misbehaviour. Some use common law, where the judge recalls what was decided the last time that the cow broke through the fence and grazed in the neighbour's field. Others rely on written rules from the governor or the overseas monarch.
With two jobs the village courthouse produces three law and one culture.

The town courthouse expands its purview to contracts and business law. It still hears criminal cases but they're a distraction from the decisions that really matter. There's a long list of hanging offences.
With three jobs the town courthouse produces four law and two culture. Before it can be built the settlement needs a town hall and a village courthouse.

The city courthouse still has to control violence and money, but dangerous ideas are increasingly subject to regulation. The jails have political prisoners alongside drunks and con artists. Sometimes all three are the same person.
With four jobs the city courthouse produces five law and three culture.

The Supreme Court exists as a counterbalance to government. Rules are made consistent. Many laws have a strong religious component. Precedent remains important, so the Supreme Court is a force for social continuity.
With six jobs the Supreme Court produces six law and five culture. The colony must have three city courthouses before the Supreme Court can be built.
Jail is how the settlement handles drunks, domestic disputes, witches and thieves. Murderers don't stay in jail for long because they're hanged. Thieves are hanged later.
Jail is how the settlement handles drunks, domestic disputes, witches and thieves. Murderers don't stay in jail for long because they're hanged. Thieves are hanged later.
